column1: AAAI Technical Track: Game Theory and Economic Paradigms
Much of the social choice literature examines direct voting systems
column2: in which voters submit their ranked preferences over candidates and a voting rule picks a winner. Real-world elections and decision-making processes are often more complex and involve multiple stages. For instance
column3: one popular voting system filters candidates through primaries: first
column4: voters affiliated with each political party vote over candidates of their own party and the voting rule picks a candidate from each party
column5: which then compete in a general election.
